qigong.title: Qigong â€“ Reconnection Through Movement | Gong & Motion
qigong.description: A gentle, meditative practice to harmonise body, mind, and spirit. Join our Qigong workshops for self-healing and reconnection.
qigong.hero_subtitle: A gentle, meditative practice to harmonise body, mind, and spirit.
qigong.what_is_qigong_content:
In our modern lives, many of us spend much of our time in our thoughts, often feeling disconnected from our deeper selves and from the world around us. Qigong offers a way backâ€”a path to reconnection. This gentle, meditative practice has been used for thousands of years to harmonise body, mind, and spirit.

Qigong's true origins stretch far back into ancient China, beyond the reach of clear historical records. While documented references date back around 2,500 years, Chinese historians and archaeologists have found evidence of similar practices as far back as 5,000 years ago.

Over the centuries, Qigong has been known by many names. One of the earliest was Dao Yin, meaning "guiding and leading the energy." The term Qigong itself did not come into common use until the twentieth century.

At its heart, Qigong encourages us to slow down, become present, and reconnectâ€”with ourselves, with others, and with nature. Through regular practice, we begin to move in rhythm with life, cultivating a sense of balance, awareness, and vitality. More than just an exercise, Qigong is a living tradition that supports well-being on every level.
qigong.workshop_intro: Join us for a relaxed and welcoming one-day workshop where you'll learn the simple yet powerful practice of Qigong for self-healing.

workshop_benefits.gentle_movements: Learn gentle, flowing movements that support health and well-being
workshop_benefits.stress_relief: Discover how Qigong can ease stress and promote inner calm
workshop_benefits.guided_practice: Experience guided practice in a supportive and interactive space
workshop_benefits.daily_tools: Gain practical tools to integrate into your daily life

qigong.workshop_note: Qigong is easy to learn and can be adapted for all abilitiesâ€”it can be practiced standing or sitting. Whether you're new to Qigong or have some experience, you are welcome to join!

workshop_details.cost: Cost: â‚¬180 (includes tuition, written materials, audio and practice classes)

qigong.teacher_bio:
Eileen Murray is a Qigong Instructor with over 30 years of experience in mental health. A certified lineage holder of Essence Qigong, she also trains and certifies Qigong teachers.

With a background as a nurse, psychotherapist, Biodynamic bodywork therapist, and Conscious Movement Teacher, Eileen brings a deep understanding of mind-body connection to her teaching. She has worked in Australia, Sweden, the UK, and Ireland, offering a wealth of experience in health and well-being.

testimonials.mary: The online Qigong workshop was a very worthwhile experience. Eileen is an excellent teacher, delivering the course in a thorough yet relaxing way. Her calm teaching method made it very enjoyable, with ample time for practice, discussion, and questions. â€“ Mary, Cork, Ireland
testimonials.joan: The Zoom experience was very uplifting. It offered all the benefits of in-person learning, with clear instructions, a warm and encouraging environment, and ample time for queries. I am now practicing Qigong daily again and so grateful for this experience. â€“ Joan, Sligo, Ireland (80 years old)

experience_needed.question: Do I need previous experience?
experience_needed.answer: No, Qigong is easy to learn and suitable for beginners as well as more experienced practitioners.

limited_mobility.question: Can I practice if I have limited mobility?
limited_mobility.answer: Yes, Qigong can be practiced either standing or sitting, and movements can be adapted to different abilities.

online_requirements.question: What do I need for the online workshop?
online_requirements.answer: A quiet space, comfortable clothing, and a stable internet connection. A chair is also useful if you prefer to practice seated.

qigong.closing_text: Come along and experience the gentle, transformative power of Qigong for yourself. ðŸŒ¿âœ¨

eileen.name: Eileen Murray
eileen.bio: Eileen Murray is a Qigong teacher, body psychotherapist, and movement facilitator with over 30 years of experience in mental health and holistic well-being. Her work blends movement, stillness, and deep listening to help people reconnect with themselvesâ€”emotionally, mentally, and physically.

kari.name: Kari Korkeamaki
kari.bio:
Has played gong for 12 years and offered many gong baths in various formatsâ€”together with yoga, at festivals, individual sessions, with hypnosis, and outdoors in nature.
Assisted with gong at Open Floor in Ireland and Sweden. Sees both gong and dance as beautiful ways to discover your inner world, free from inhibitions and to let in new, fresh life.
